body:
$AAPL 
Apple,is expected to report its fiscal 2Q22.April 28 after the market close.
Bank of America analyst Wamsi Mohan reiterated his Buy rating and $215 price target for Apple
 🍏Apple's iPhone sales,buybacks and dividends will be the three key elements of this week's report
🍏projecting 2Q22,iPhone unit sales of 56 million,slightly below consensus analyst estimates of 57 million
In addition,Apple to authorize a new buyback program of at least $70B and raise its 0.5% dividend by 5%
🍏Q2 adjusted EPS of $1.36 on revenue of $92B. Both numbers are below consensus analyst estimates of$1.43&$93.9B,respectively
Apple as a long-term winner and believe shares have more room to rerate higher,catalysts including the opportunity to better,revenue growth,opportunity in Augmented/Virtual Reality and long-term growth in Services.
🍏projecting EPS of $5.83/$6.35/$6.82 for Apple in 2022/2023/2024,below consensus analyst estimates of $6.15/$6.55/$6.91,revenue growth of 6.1% in 2022 and 7.9% in 2023.
$SPY  all jokes aside, we’re gonna work even harder this week for more gains on simple plays like these. 🔥📣💜 $QQQ $AAPL $GOOG $QQQ
Gotta unwind after that week. $AAPL 🏌️‍♂️

$NFLX (Weekly chart) The fall was in the charts already, as it was in Distribution since September 2020, so with or without news it was supposed to be dragged down by Smart money. Notice that Netflix previous Distributions retraced back near Fib 1.618 (open chart to see fibs) overtime before the next leg up. In the reply comment I will post the monthly chart to show you. $FUBO $DIS $ROKU $AAPL
$SPY $QQQ $AAPL  we told you guys what was gonna happen weeks ago  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mmXs7lrUeBw

$AAPL 
NEXT Earning 2Q22
$AAPL

$AAPL 
Apple Q2 Earnings: 3 Things Investors Should Watch For - Benzinga

Apple, Inc.
is expected to report its fiscal second-quarter earnings on April 28 after the market close. One analyst has listed three important factors Apple investors should be watching in the Apple earnings report.
The Analyst: Bank of America analyst Wamsi Mohan reiterated his Buy rating and $215 price target for Apple.
The Thesis: Mohan said Apple's iPhone sales, buybacks and dividends will be the three key elements of this week's report.

Mohan is also calling for Q2 adjusted EPS of $1.36 on revenue of $92 billion. Both numbers are below consensus analyst estimates of $1.43 and $93.9 billion, respectively.

Mohan is projecting EPS of $5.83/$6.35/$6.82 for Apple in 2022/2023/2024, below consensus analyst estimates of $6.15/$6.55/$6.91. He is projecting revenue growth of 6.1% in 2022 and 7.9% in 2023.

https://www.benzinga.com/analyst-ratings/analyst-color/22/04/26768382/apple-earnings-3-things-investors-should-watch-for

links.title: Space Fence now has a direct link to key Space Force data hub
links.description: WASHINGTON - The U.S. Space Force announced Friday its cloud-based data environment can now ingest observation information directly from the Space Fence radar, demonstrating its ability to connect with sensor nodes in the Space Surveillance Network.

links.title: Wells Fargo confirms mortgage staff layoffs
links.description: Wells Fargo confirmed Friday it's laying off an undisclosed number of home lending employees due to mortgage market conditions, one week after reporting a major decline in origination volume. The bank in a brief statement didn't specify which employees were affected nor the amount of staff displaced, and didn't immediately respond to follow-up questions Friday afternoon.

body: $AAPL AAPL is in our Market watch for this week.  Visit my home page for  Daily update in Short Interest, News , Discussions and upcoming catalyst.  Was up $1290 just 2 trades/week  in-spite of present Market

$SPY $TSLA $GOOGL $AAPL $MSFT 

My thoughts as we head into the most important week of the year .... 

First off, my Game Plan goes out in an hour. I discuss where I believe mkts are headed as well as a breakdown of all the key earnings. I discuss the big cap tech names and which ones I would still avoid and which I like. Am I still bearish on the mkt as I've been since the first week of January? I am. But to what levels? 

Those who want to join, email me at jessielivermore1929@gmail.com 

Finally, a quick tip .... I recently heard from a member who said he doesn't short stocks/mkt. I can respect that. It isn't for everyone. However, I will say this. If you are trying to make a living as a professional trader/investor, you HAVE to know how to short stocks. It isn't easy and the risk is heavier, but it is a tool you have to have in your bag. 

We have a huge week ahead. Big cap tech. PCE data. Mkt technicals being tested. Strap on both seatbelts we are headed for some massive moves. ✌️
